correction.p: OCR generated transcript has not been corrected.

normalization.p: Only minor normalization where needed, if any, is indicated via markup.

punctuation.p: All punctuation marks in the source text have been retained, and are represented by appropriate Unicode code points.
Punctuation may be marked up with pc elements for clarification, but not exclusively.

quotation.p: All quotation marks have been retained, and are represented by appropriate Unicode code points.

hyphenation.p: Hyphenated words that appear at the end of a line have been retained. The hyphen, if present, is represented by the Unicode code point, and marked up with a pc element. The break="no" attribute on the lb element indicates that a single word is split across the lines.

interpretation.p: Dates, places, and names may be marked up, where useful.

Dickinson CollegeDiamond State ScholarI:.:AWARDSSISTER CATHERINE MORSE AWARD — Foroutstanding serviceand dedication to Ursuline Academy.NEILIA HUNTER BIDEN AWARD - For outstanding qualitiesshown through service to country, community and fellowAmericans.THE URSULINE ACADEMY PRESIDENT'S AWARD — Forexcellence in service to school, church and community.SERVIAM AWARD — For exemplifying the spirit of the UrsulineMotto, "I Will Serve."AGNES HORTY MAY ALUMNAE AWARD — For outstandingqualities representing the standards and ideals of UrsulineAcademy, including scholarship, extra-curricular projects, leadership and those qualities of character that make for the well-being ofthe whole community.AMERICAN LEGION AWARD — For outstanding scholarship,leadership and citizenship, marked especially by the qualities ofcourage, loyalty and service.CROSS OF MERIT AWARD — For outstanding service and loyaltyto the school and to the student body, marked especially by thosequalities of Christian womanhood most expected of an UrsulineGraduate.DEPARTMENTAL HONORSDepartmental Honors and Certificates are merited in the followingareas:ArtEnglishForeign LanguagesMathematicsReligionScienceSocial StudiesGENERAL EXCELLENCEThe General Excellence Award isthe highestacademic honorthata student of Ursuline Academy may receive at the end of her highschool years. This award indicates that the young woman hasmaintained the highest possible academic work in all of hersubjects for four years.NINETY-SIXTH ANNUALCOMMENCEMENTURSULlNEgPACAnF.MYWilmington, DelawareSunday, June Third1990

CHURCH STAFF
ROBERT PRESTON WHITLGCK, Pastor
HARVEY MANCHESTER, JR., Associate Pastor
KERRY OIETZ, Music Program Director/Organist
RICHARD THOMAS, Assistant Organist
ANNE H. MAY, Secretary
CLARDELLWIMBERLY, Custodian
BRUCE & DORIS OBENSHAIN, Dur Missionaries in Zaire
ALL OUR MEMBERS, Ministers
WORKSHOP OPPORTUNITY
Choose any one of these six workshops.
1. New Teachers of All Age Levels
2. Using Learning Centers with Children
3. Telling Stories to Children
4. How to Organize New Adult Church School Classes
5. Strengthening the United Methodist Youth Fellowships
6. Planning Church Family Nights
Asbury Methodist Church, New Castle
September 2nd — 7:30 to 9:30 P.M.
Registration forms are available outside the office.
OUTREACH CONTACT FOR AUGUST 23-31: Elizabeth Hopkins (571-8551)
The Junior High UMYF needs counselors. Please call Randy and Ruth Overbey (798-3795)
and volunteer to help them in this very important task. Our youth need you.
Note: The Wednesday morning Bible Study will begin September 8th (9:45 -11:00 A.M.).
August 22, 1982
The Twelfth Sunday after Pentecost
Upon entering the Sanctuary please maintain an atmosphere of worship so as not to
disturb those who wish to meditate.
PRELUDE — Choral Prelude on "We Believe in One God" Johann Pachelbel
(1653-1706)
CALL TO WORSfflP
Bless the Lord, O my soul; and all that is within me, bless his holy name!
BLESS THE LORD, O MY SOUL, AND FORGET NOT ALL HIS BENEFITS,
who forgives all your iniquity, who heals all your diseases,
WHO REDEEMS YOUR LIFE FROM THE PIT, WHO CROWNS YOU
WITH STEADFAST LOVE AND MERCY.
As a father pities his children, so the Lord pities those who know him
FOR HE KNOWS OUR FRAME; HE REMEMBERS THAT WE ARE DUST.
As for us, our days are like grass; we flourishes like a flower of the field;
FOR THE WIND PASSES OVER IT, AND IT IS GONE, AND ITS PLACE
KNOWS IT NO MORE.
But the steadfast love of the Lord is from everlasting to everlasting upon those who
fear him, and his righteousness to children's children,
TO THOSE WHO KEEP HIS COVENANT AND REMEMBER TO DO HIS
COMMANDMENTS.
Bless the Lord, O you his angels, you mighty ones who do his word, hearkening to the
voice of his word!
BLESS THE LORD, ALL HIS HOSTS, HIS MINISTERS THAT DO HIS
WILL!
Bless the Lord, all his works, in all places of his dominion.
BLESS THE LORD, O MY SOUL!
— Psalm 103:1-4, 13-18, 20-22
* HYMN OF PRAISE — "Stand Up and Bless the Lord" No. 16
NEW TESTAMENT LESSON I John 2:1-17
SILENT PRAYER
It is the will of God:
To gather together in one all things in Christ, both which are in heaven and which are
on earth.
That we should show forth his praises who called us out of the darkness into his
marvelous light.
That we should believe in him and love him with all our heart, with all our mind^ with
all our soul,and with all our strength.
That we should worship him and put our whole trust in him all the days of our life.
LORD, HAVE MERCY UPON US, AND INCLINE OUR HEARTS TO DO
YOUR WILL.
RESPONSE
PRAYERS OF THANKSGIVING — PETITION — INTERCESSION
(During intercessory prayer the congregation is urged to lift names audibly or silently.)
Let us unite in prayer for grace to do God's will.
O LORD, WE BESEECH THEE MERCIFULLY TO RECEIVE OUR
PRAYERS: AND GRANT THAT WE MAY BOTH PERCEIVE AND KNOW
WHAT THINGS WE OUGHT TO DO, AND ALSO MAY HAVE GRACE
AND POWER FAITHFULLY TO FILFILL THE SAME; THROUGH JESUS
CHRIST OUR LORD. AMEN.
THE LORD'S PRA YER
THE SACRAMENT OF BAPTISM (11:00)
Receiving the Sacrament of Baptism: Casey Elizabeth Rapp, daughter of
James and Linda Rapp.
BAPTISMAL RESPONSE — "This is the Spirit's Entry Now"
Asbury Ensemble
PARISH ANNOUNCEMENTS
OFFERING OF GIFTS — "The Great Commandments" (8:45)
"Apple-Red Happiness"
Trinity/Wesley Choir
"Everything is Beautiful" (11:00)
Cherub Choir and Dr. Whitlock
♦DOXOLOGY
OLD TESTAMENT LESSON Job 19:13-27
THE SERMON — "The Need for an Advocate: Who Speaks on Our Behalf?"
Dr. Whitlock
SILENT PRAYER
* HYMN — "God of Grace and God of Glory" No. 470
* BENEDICTION
SILENT PRAYER Congregation seated and bowed
POSTLUDE — Rigaudon Andre Campra (1660-1774)
Arr. by E. Power Biggs
* Congregation standing
Scripture Readers: Georgeann Powell at 8:45 and Bob Hedgepath at 11:00.
WELCOME
A cordial welcome is extended to all those visiting today. Please complete one of the visitor
cards from the pew rack and place in the offering plate.
TODAY
The flowers at the chancel are given to the Glory of God and in loving memory of
Frank H. Travis, Jr. by his family.
The additional flowers are given in honor of the marriage of Linda Meyers and David Miller.
The rose on the altar is to announce the arrival of a son, David William, to Jack and Judy
Stoppel. David is the grandson of Bill and Nancy Whigham.
Acolytes: Amy Huston at 8:45 and Josh Erickson at 11:00.
9:45 A.M. Worship Service. Child care to beginning of First Grade.
9:45 A.M. Church School for all ages beginning at age two. Child care for Infants
and Toddlers.
11:00 A.M. Worship Service. Child care to beginning of First Grade.
12:15 P.M. Nominating Committee meets in Church Lounge.
THIS WEEK
TUESDAY
9:00 A.M. Exercise Class
9:30 A.M. Sharing Group at Fran Ackerson's, 2116 Valley Road.
6:00 P.M. Family Picnic at Bellevue State Park.
7:30 P.M. Building Committee meets in Church Lounge.
WEDNESDAY
7:30 P.M. Junior High UMYF Planning Meeting.
FRIDAY
9:00 A.M. Exercise Class — Please note: This is a change of day.
